name: Diane Lader
text: We had our 35 yr high school reunion here and it was perfect!  Plenty of parking, definitely large enough to accommodate a large group of people. And you can’t ask for a more beautiful area.

name: Aleem Gillani
text: Nice place. Good enough venue. Pretty setup. Problem is poor acoustics in the barn due to hard surfaces on floor, walls and ceiling. Good band was made to sound bad due to the acoustics.

name: Bocephus (Nate Dawg)
text: Awesome wedding venue for all those lovebirds!!!

name: Jeff McKelvey
text: Kylee Cooper Farms is the perfect wedding venue. Especially if you're looking for an outside wedding venue that has inside options. It's rustic and country, yet can be transformed into elegant. My daughter had a wedding shower here and it was great and we booked her wedding as well. This place is nice for people who live in the Lake Martin or Central Alabama area. The owners are really professional and friendly. Highly Recommended.

name: Teresa McKelvey
text: The space is absolutely beautiful and they had everything there we needed. Tables, chairs, linens, and a beautiful setting. We hosted a bridal shower there and it was amazing.

name: Josh Bankston
text: It was our first time doing an escape room and had a blast!   Good pricing and great staff.   Highly recommend if you're in the area and looking for something fun to do.

name: Anna Clardy
text: This place was terrible. Some friends and I went last weekend and found the key to our room in 15 minutes and were confused because we’d barely opened any boxes. The guy working told us our room had been put back together wrong and items and clues were out of order and he didn’t know why. He wasn’t going to give us our money back or anything, we had to ask him if we could come back again the next week since it was a waste of time and money. He let us do that so that was the only good thing. We literally came back this weekend and our room was messed up AGAIN. We were missing clues and nothing made sense, we tried to call for clues/help multiple times and had to wait TWENTY minutes until after time ran out when the worker finally came back. So basically we spent 20 minutes looking for clues that werent there then we sat in our room for over 30 minutes just waiting on someone to come help us and let us out. It was absolutely ridiculous. We still never got our money back and we refused to come back again for another “correct” room. In addition to all of that, THE DESCRIPTIONS OF THEIR ROOMS ON THE WEBSITE ARE NOT WHAT THE ROOM ARE ACTUALLY LIKE. we were disappointed because we chose both of our rooms based on the online description yet when we got in both rooms the storyline was COMPLETELY different. Super unprofessional, the workers hardly know the clues or how the rooms work themselves. I wouldn’t recommend this place to anyone. One of my worst experiences and I will never go back. PLEASE SAVE YOUR TIME AND MONEY AND GO TO BREAKOUT TUSCALOOSA INSTEAD!!

name: Bethany Donaldson
text: We had my son’s birthday party here. It was a huge hit with both parents & kids! The kids all worked together to solve the clues. Definitely recommend!

name: Kimberly Smith
text: I wish there was an option for zero stars! This is the biggest waste of 20 dollars I’ve ever spent. The associate was nice but had no clue what was supposed to happen in the room. These five star ratings have to be fake! When I asked for a refund the associate shrugged and said nobody in the store can give refunds and to call the corporate office for a refund DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE

resp.text: Hey Kimberly, could you send your contact information to mgr115@allinadventures.com. I would like to discuss this further with you. Thanks! Have a great day!

name: YourCurlfriend 1
text: The rooms we chose were a bit challenging but the staff was great! We accepted the challenge twice within 7 days and we’ll be back again. I can’t wait!

name: Jeffrey Phipps
text: Great way of putting down the phone and reminding ourselves the family can work together when you locked in a room.UCF the true national champions undefeated and beat Auburn.

name: Ryan West
text: Pretty fun experience but not very elaborate. A little on the plain side with few props and decorations compared to other escape rooms that cost around $20.

name: Kristie Abernathy
text: Only reason I picked a star was to write this review! This place was the biggest waste of money I’ve ever EVER spent!!!!! This place deserves a negative 5 stars!!!! Close it down!

name: Alex Gray
text: Fun

name: Shonice Pitts
text: We recently rented a bounce house from Jump To It for a birthday party. The bounce house was very clean and people of all ages were able to enjoy it during the party. I truly enjoyed the service provided by the company! Everyone I interacted with over the phone or in person were very helpful and friendly. They were able to clearly answer any questions I had about the booking and payment process. I will be booking from them again!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review Shonice! We had such a great experience we would like to extend free delivery on your next reservation! Thank you again 😀

name: Brian Wright
text:
I wasn't going to leave a review since I never actually received the slide however when the person showed up to set it up that was the tipping point.

So we rented a water slide, the tropical 18 foot water slide, and were very excited for our kids birthday party. We paid in full as we always do with rentals and we're ready for a great party. We requested set-up for 10:00 since party was from 12 - 3, keep that in mind for later. A week and a half before the party we went to the website and noticed the slide we rented had been removed which raised concern. Ended up calling Jump To It Inc and asking why it was removed and brought up some negative reviews which we read on Google. First they told me there were some issues and they would call me back, never did. I called them again Monday the following week and they stated they had issues with the slide we rented and it was being repaired. The person whom I spoke with stated it "should be" good for our party but if I see another I like they will swap it out. So I go on their site and searched and had to pretend like I was going to reserve just to see what was available. This whole experience left me uneasy so I went with another company and cancelled the rental and they gave me a refund minus 30 dollars which is a surcharge and that's fine.

Fast forward to the day of the party and the delivery guy shows up to setup the slide. I explain to him we cancelled the order and he was nice and ended up leaving. Keep in mind above the party was 12 - 3, he shows up at 3. This made me very glad we cancelled as the party went well but had we kept it the delivery wouldn't even have occurred until after the party.

resp.text: Thank you for you’re review. The slide you reserved and cancelled was ordered again at the last minute for 4pm that day. The delivery guy was mistakenly sent the incorrect invoice showing your reservation. Luckily it was corrected in time to be delivered to the correct person for them to have a wonderful event! Our apologies for the mistake and confusion. Thank you for your review 🙂

name: Amanda Joiner
text: I rented a bouncy house for my son's birthday party and when the delivery men came to set it up it was the wrong one that we paid for. They had to reload it back into the truck and bring the right one. The party started at 2 and they didn't get back until 3 when they originally came at 10:30 in the morning the first time. After they got it setup they were suppose to come back at 5:30 to pick it up but didn't come get the bouncy house until almost 9 at night. We called numerous of times and they did not communicate well on what was going on and kept saying they were on there way but it was getting later and later. They kept asking for directions when we explained it to them several times. The bouncy house was dirty and had leaves all in it. I understand things happen and people make mistakes but the amount that I paid for that bouncy house wasn't worth all the trouble it was and the quality wasn't great either for the price they charge for just 3 hours. We won't be renting from them again or reffering anyone else we know either.

resp.text: Hello Amanda, we would like to make this right! Please give us a call or email so we can mend the actions of the back up drivers we used that weekend. Hope to hear from you soon!

name: tanisha arseneau
text: It’s not everyday you run into a company that’s all about their customers and the community!! I’m the Program director for Girls on the Run North Alabama in Madison County and we had not been able to find any company willing to donate a bounce house. Well I reached out to the owner of Jump to it and without hesitation he said to find the one you like and book it!! GOTR is a non profit organization and our mission is to inspire girls to be joyful, healthy and confident using a fun, experience-based curriculum which creatively integrates running. This was our Fall 5K and It wouldn’t have been such a fun filled event without the bounce house. The delivery was on time and the guys were extremely respectful and kind. We thank you so much Jump to it for working with us and giving back to the community with your generous donation!!! We look forward to seeing your continuous growth and success!!! ❤️

resp.text: Thank you!!

name: Amanda Dickey
text: My sister rented a water slider last weekend for my sons birthday party, I was so humiliated the palm trees wouldn't stay up they kept laying over the slide and steps. The slide was full of holes and tears with duct tape over some. We had to wear t-shirts because the slide was so rough people were getting hurt by the slide. It was supposed to be dropped off at 11 it wasn't there until 2, then we couldn't find the water hook up and when my sister called we found out there was no hook up and we had to fix the hose pipe up on the slide to wet it, we did they didn't. This company is not helpful and we will never use them again. We should get a full refund for this!

name: Rachel Dickey
text: Went to a party last weekend and my daughter rented a waterslide from jump to it. It was awful...It was old, torn and patched with duct tape, the palm trees wouldn't stay up. Alot of people were hurt by the rough slide. There was no place to connect the water hose and they informed us you get wet then slide down makes it a waterslide. They dropped it off late and picked it up late. Very disappointed!!!!

name: Christina Wolde
text: I rented a bounce house and a dry slide today.  The bounce house was great.  However, the dry slide was very difficult to slide down.  There was something on the surface that seemed to have the effect of sliding down a rubber material.  I had to on purpose use my hands to work my way down to the slide to the end.  I have rented slides from other companies in the past and never had this problem.  The kids had the same problem too and ultimately found the slide very boring and disinteresting.  It was almost as if it had a residue on it that caused resistance the whole way down.  We called and told the company but they just acted like that sounded very strange.  We asked them to try the slide themselves when they came to pick it up but we never heard anything after that.

name: carey FRASIER
text: was not what I expected but received a professional response to resolve the matter.

text: We ordered a Water Slide for Memorial Day weekend and it was so much fun. It was a hot Day and everyone enjoyed cooling off at our backyard BBQ. Thank you Jump to it for being prompt and affordable. My family from ages 5 - 48 was on the water slide having the time of their life 💯❤️

text: We ordered a water slide for our end of Girls Inc. summer camp for the girls.  They had a blast. We had other outdoor games and activities to play but the water slide was a hit.  Thanks to Jump to It for making our end of summer camp a great success!

text: I have used Jump To It services twice and each time I had a really good experience! I love the fact it’s a locally owned company. The young guys who did the delivery were very sweet and respectful and most importantly they were on time!!!! I would refer this business to anyone who has kids or just wants to add something different to an event.

resp.text: Thank you for your business.

name: Jamie Algie Wilson
text: The staff at Jump To It were very helpful, kind and professional. From delivery to take down everything was perfect. I will definitely call them again for my inflatable needs!

name: Laura Foster
text:
In June I had plans to rent a water slide bounce house combination unit, I reserved it and paid for it weeks in advance. I was called about a week before by someone in the office, they said it was being repaired so I needed to pick a different unit AND pay the difference. I didn't want just a slide or just a bounce house, and I didn't want to spend $150 more dollars for a different combination unit, I thought that was unfair and wanted to cancel my reservation. As soon as I told them I wanted to cancel The customer service went from great to fair (and by the end of my experience, poor).They called again and said they would give me a different combination unit that cost more and they would discount the amount so it was priced equal to what I had reserved. We ended up changing the date of the event partly because of this issue and our event was rescheduled to the last weekend in July. On the invoice I received the day before the event it showed a combination unit, that was priced more than the original and that they discounted the price so I didn't owe more. I was happy, it was what I wanted; a bounce house and slide together. When they show up on Saturday they bring a completely different unit. It was ONLY a slide. This is not what I wanted. The event was for a 2 year old and he (and many of the other kids) couldn't even enjoy this particular slide because it was for much older children.
I'm really disappointed in this experience and had I known I was getting a slide only I would have cancelled. I sent Jump To It an email more than two weeks ago to let them know I wasn't happy and haven't heard one word back from them.

name: Malp Sugimoto
text: I rented the 68 ft obstacle course today. Everything arrived on time and looked great. I've always had wonderful experiences with Jump To It and I will continue to use them for all of my kids parties.

resp.text: Thank you

name: Jonathan Johnson
text: Very satisfied with the equipment we rented. Once it was set up we had a great time and everyone loved it! We used the basketball toss inflatable. However, the reason for no 5 star review is due to the lack of timeliness from the company. Our event started at 3:00pm, we were told the inflatable would be there by 2:00pm, 1 hour prior to the event kicking off. They arrived around 3:20pm. If they could fix their scheduling and logistics, then this would have been a 5 star experience.

name: jamie hardiman
text: I am the PTO President of a local elementary school and we have rented from the company 3 times. The 2nd time was for a school carnival.  We asked them to be there 2 hours before the carnival and they were late, they finished setting up right as the carnival started and left.   Right after they left a volunteer called me to the area and told me the inflatable wasn't staying inflated.  Turns out they didn't attach enough blowers (they had some of the sections knotted off). I called them and they couldn't come right back so the inflatable was down for about an hour of our 3 hour FUNDRAISER carnival.  As an "I am sorry" they offered a 50% discount on the next rental.   We decided to take them up on their offer and rented 2 inflatables for our Halloween Trunk or Treat.  Again, I asked them to be there at a certain time to leave plenty of time for set up and they were late again.  They pulled up 5 minutes before the event time and we had to block off our trunk or treat area and delay the start because their trucks were in the area of where the kids had to go.  They set up and left.  About 10 minutes into the carnival I got a call from a volunteer that there were 2 kids hurt on the inflatable because it wasn't staying inflated in the middle.  I inspected and it was not properly working.  I called Corey and he said he couldn't come back so we had to shut the inflatable down.  I communicated with him after the event about how unhappy we were and he informed me he would be sending a refund (I have this in a text message from him).  When I never got the refund he then said he would rather give us a discount on a future rental. I told him that we will never be renting from him again and we wanted the refund he told us he would be giving.  This business has ruined part of TWO fundraisers for a local elementary school and shows no remorse for the kids that got hurt.  We had two young children with bloody noses because of the improper equipment (there were not enough blowers on the inflatables, both times there were sections knotted off without blowers attached).  This is poor business practice and I would NEVER recommend ANYONE to use this company.

name: Vickie Clemmons
text: My daughter paid $45.00 each for both of our projects 2/3 weeks prior to the class. When we arrived, we were told they did not have anyone signed up for that class. My daughter showed her email for payment conformation. The instructor said she would have to cut our pieces. It seemed a bother. We stood around for a while & she finally told us to sit with another class. I feel like we were not shown the attention as everyone else. We had to ask for paint, brushes, & water to clean the brushes. We are pretty crafty so we just looked at the sample and completed it on our own. We did not get holes drilled for the hanger...she could not work the drill and the piece was not sealed. I do not recommend this business. Everyone should be treated with the same attention.....very disappointed!!

name: Nameless Faceless
text:
My mom, niece, and I had a pretty abysmal experience here.
It was our third time doing a sip and paint class (I don't even want to call it a class at this point). There was little to no direction by the "instructor" who made it VERY clear that she was not supposed to be there that late and informed us that the girl who was supposed to teach the class couldn't make it.
Like many other establishments like this, they offer a variety of painting classes at different levels of difficulty. You also have the option to "upgrade" your painting by purchasing a larger canvas.
Another thing that most of these places do is sell the paintings that the instructors do during every class. I wish I could say that they're affordable and worth the price, but that definitely is not the case. When I inquired about which paintings were for sale and about the general cost, the woman got snarky with me. After paying well over $100 to for little to no instruction and having an overall bland experience, I did not want to give this place any more of my money.
PAINTER'S TIP:
I would suggest stopping by Walmart (or ordering off Amazon) and getting a cheap variety pack of paintbrushes (I posted a photo of the pack I purchased). I found that the brushes they supplied were a little worn out and often I couldn't get my lines as thin as I wanted them (I have a heavy hand).

name: Brandi Paustian
text: We love The Broken Brush! Jessica is a great teacher and it is always so much fun. My 12 year old son loves it too.

text: I just can't even with this place

name: Jonae Mitzel
text: Would be much better described as a "play room" than a "children's museum". Their website describes it as 8,000+ square feet of imaginative, educational-centered play which is also deeply inaccurate. They are using about 1/8 of that space and it is more or less just toys scattered around. There are a few themed rooms - hospital, fire department, etc - but they are very small, like walk in closet size, and not much to them aside from somewhat themed toys that may either be in there or are more probable to be scattered somewhere around the rest of the room. There are no exhibits and I have more educational toys/activities/opportunities for learning in my own home. My not quite 2-year old was asking to leave after 20 minutes here. When we visit the actual childrens museum at home, she is crying to stay even if we've been there for 2 hours already. We read a bunch of raving (and in my opinion, very misleading) reviews & came from out of town to visit. We were very disappointed.

text: Awesome place! It's a big open area full of toys and stations, with party rooms available. Plenty of different toys and games to play with. The owners are very friendly, and parents can buy a cheap coffee and snack to enjoy while the kids play. Daphne seriously needed a place like this, it's a calm alternative to the loud, high impact trampoline place in Spanish Fort.

text: My 3 year old son goes here 2 days a week for school,  9 am - 1pm and free play, parties, and more activities I could ever imagine! This a great place for young toddlers to attend before preschool helping their socialization and so many other things!

name: Its Just Marshall
text:
Absolutely love this place! It’s filled with tons of activity centers like blocks, art, dress up, trains, a castle, a huge play ship in the center, a fire station room, movie theater, dance party, and many, many more awesome adventures!
They even have a large area squared off by a 2 foot wall/bench for caregivers and parents to play with their infants without toddlers trampling them but at the same time being perfectly located in the center of the main room with a view of the entire play area allowing parents with infants to watch their toddlers play. I recommend it to anyone with children ages newborn to around age 8.
They have so many different things to offer! Not to mention the owner who is an absolute delight! Every month she fills the calendar with innovative parties, exciting classes & events and things such as “date nights” as well as weekly dance classes that don’t require any signup or monthly commitment. In the mood to dance? Just show up on the designated days and boogie!
There’s so much more I haven’t even mentioned so just trust me and go check it out! You won’t be disappointed!!! You’ll be hooked just like me!
Extremely reasonably priced, spotlessly clean and thoroughly sanitized as well as conveniently located! I’m so impressed with this place! My first & only visit was today however rest assured I’ll be returning next week :) and the next... I’ll be recommending it to everyone I know!
LOVE LOVE LOVES IT!!!
1 last tidbit of bonus information...It’s on the market! I certainly wish I had the means to buy what can only be described as an incredibly lucrative business that’s sure to be a HUGE money maker for its new owners!
My guess is that you’re thinking I must be benefiting from this review but I can assure you I am in no way benefiting nor do I have any connection whatsoever with anyone connected to the Wonderland Childrens Museum in any way. I’m simply a local parent who took my daughter to her classmates birthday party there today. I simply fell in love <3

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback.  We do wonder if you have ever actually been here though, since you have only two Google reviews on your profile, 1 for us and 1 for The Alley at the same exact time.  We are not in competition with The Alley, we want their establishment to succeed as well as ours.  Our hope is that more entertainment offered in our area is good for everyone.  We offer different types of games and do not claim to be the same as The Alley.  We work very hard to keep our arcade clean and sanitized, and make sure that all of our games are up and running at all times.  Some games can't be open because we are trying to maintain social distancing guidelines.  Our goal is for our customers to come in and have fun and forget about some of the stress of the world for a while.  Again, thanks for your review, we welcome you to come and give us another try and will always try our best to improve customer experience.

name: Jessica ann
text: Our daughter had her 6th bday party here & it was a hit! Both friends and family bragged to me about how fun the party was, how organized it was, & how great the staff at pump it up took over and hosted the party.  The young staff at pump it up do an excellent job!! They did everything! Cut the cake, passed out pizza & drinks, played with the children, took pictures of the party, & even helped my daughter open her presents. The only thing I had to do was drive the car up & load them.  Amazing party experience & I’ve had parties for my kids at different surrounding locations & this was by far the best experience. The only downfall, it is a bit pricey, but the kids have a blast & in the end it was totally worth it to save a few months for this top notch experience. Thanks pump it up Trussville!

name: Brandy Wickliffe
text:
My family has been going to Trussville Urban Air since they opened and as a surprise for my sons 8th birthday we booked him a party on 12/4. I am absolutely appalled at the staffing of this establishment. My son and his friend (both 10) were physically assaulted by a group of teenagers (15). Now I know, kids can be wild but I had several adults that I didnt know run to find me when this happened. My older nephew attempted to intervene as these children were stomping on my sons stomach and forcibly holding him under the ball pit. I was informed by multiple adult witnesses who confirmed this was in fact what was happening. When my nephew tried to tell the boys to leave my 10 year old son alone the boys ADULT father bowed up on my nephew making threats yelling in his face. My nephew is also A CHILD. There were ZERO staff members to be found and when I was finally able to talk to a manager (Tiffany) I was disrespected and cut off mid sentence. She refused to hear my concerns. I was completely rational and calm as I was just trying to speak with someone in charge and have the cameras viewed so I could find out what actions should be taken. When asked to speak to someone above her she refused to give me any name or contact info and WALKED AWAY mid sentence. We have always enjoyed bringing our children here, but if I am paying for a party that large with that many children I would expect my guests to be SAFE. I would love to speak with someone above the managers on staff due to the absolute lack of professionalism they displayed. It is not my intention to be tacky or tasteless but I am shocked at how children being visibly injured was met by "management". This establishment should be well staffed for the level of children it sees on a nightly basis and all of the children should feel and BE safe. Staff members do not supervise in any way, like other trampoline parks do. spending close to 500$ for a 2 hour party, my child and his friend were jumped on kicked and bullied by 5 teenage boys and the manager (Tiffany) didn't even offer an apology or ask the children if they were okay.. nothing. My experience was awful. Tiffany would not hear my concerns, would not review the cameras and let me know the severity of the situation. Due to this, 5 kids left my sons party and I was left feeling a HUGE lack of customer service. The chosen manager of this establishment should put children first, listen to the concerns of paying patrons and have solutions. She was the most disrespectful manager I have ever met. I had my  son and his friend upset right in front of her and she barely looked at them, didn't ask if they were okay. She walked away.

after reaching out to an owner, I was not offered any resolution or an offer of looking at the camera. Simply "I'll speak to tiffany about this" and s"orry this happened". finally got the apology that should have happened days before but too little too late. what resolution would you expect if this happened at a party you were hosting and it was your children being hurt?

great leadership comes from the top. get it together. while I know these specific incidents are isolated, you should know how to handle these situations and so should your staff. view  the cameras, even if the patron cannot. have a resolution.

name: Lesa Roush
text:
**Edited to ad more review** party booked for 11-1 said I could arrive 15mins prior for set up yet they don't open their doors till 11, they also fail to disclosethat the premium activities I paid for for the older kids don'topen till noon, when I booked 11-1, kids only got an hour to play on the rock wall, zip line and ceiling corse** very disappointed, will probably not book anymore parties here in the future.

Very fun but for the price you pay which is high, they shouldn't limit it to 2hrs or lower the price to reflect the 2hr limit. Also the employees should not be sitting around talking bad about other employees where customers can hear them. Very unprofessional. Have a party booked and even though I booked online and placed the pizza order they still require you to call the Thursday before your party and you can never get anyone to answer the phone, so I left messages that have gone unanswered and her party is tomorrow. Hopefully they got my message and the pizzas will be ready. Very disappointed so far with the service.

name: Katie A.
text:
we attended a 12 yr old's birthday party here and it was great! There are so many things to do that even when they were super crowded and busy there was always something to do. There's a mini obstacle course over a ball pit. There are various trampoline areas designated for jumping. dodgeball, basketball etc.  a balance beam over a foam pit for kids battling to knock each other off..There are areas that are for small children only as well.   there are massage chairs spread out about a place for the parents to sit in if you put money in for a massage. (Don't get carried away .. No matter how much you enjoy it... If you do more than 20minutes, your body is probably going to be sore the next day or two) for a little extra money there is also a rock climbing wall and a zip line that will send you across the building to one side and then whip you around back to where you started from instead of just going straight across so that was really cool. There's an area where you can be tethered above for safety but being able to walk across small platforms or climb across a web of rope... they're just a lot of things to do. I saw the children of all ages they're having a good time. ( my 15 yr old going through one of those phases where nothing entertains him... Actually had his face light up .. so I paid for him to play outside of the party.
It can be a bit expensive covering the person and then buying their special socks required.. but the kids really did enjoy it so it's worth it.

name: Matt Besecker
text:
The Pros:

Lots of things for a 6 year old to do for hours.

Reasonably priced for what it is.

Food is good.

Facility was clean and in good shape.

The Cons:

One of the main attractions “The Ropes” was not working and no discount was made to reflect this for the ultimate package.

The entire staff looked like they hate life. They play amongst themselves and give very little attention to the children. Parents had to whistle and wave down staff to unhook their kids at the rock wall area because the staff were too busy huddled up together talking. When they were actually doing their job, they all had sad faces like they had been yelled at for something 5 minutes ago.

Please retrain your staff.

name: Kim James
text:
Please do not let your kids ride in the air here!! Please do not enter the building while anyone is in the air!!!!!

PLEASE DO NOT LET YOUR KIDS RIDE ANY OF THE AIR ATTRACTIONS HERE WITHOUT BEING ADVISED THAT AN AIR ROPES COURSE RIDER WHO APPEARED TO BE STILL STRAPPED IN THE HARNESS FELL SEVERAL FEET JUST LAST FRIDAY 3/29/19, AND THE COMMUNITY IS NOT AWARE OF THIS.  Don't let it be your kid please!  PEOPLE SITTING DOWN ON THE GROUND BELOW WERE ALSO HARMED!!!!

This is important!! I'll repeat it.  If you plan to go and play it safe by not riding in the air, then this review is still for you and all of your family  because PEOPLE SITTING DOWN ON THE GROUND BELOW WERE ALSO HARMED!!!!

Please read on or call to try to find out for yourself before you go.  I don't want it to happen again to anyone!!  I've tried many times for a week now, but I can't reach any local or corporate officials with Urban Air to explain or calm our fears.  Who checks on these things?  Who answers to every parent that takes their kids to Urban Air?
It's Friday again and I'm trying not to scream at the thought that Urban Air Trampoline and Adventure Park in Trussville is still open (as far as I know) and still not answering any real questions about last Friday's horrific experience.   This wasn't your average bounce on the trampoline and break an ankle thing. This was a HORRIBLE NIGHTMARE that really happened to innocent people.   Urban Air, what's preventing it from happening again?

How do you drop a person from the sky?  Why did you drop her on top of a mom who was simply sitting on a bench below? It Was Horrible!!! There is so much more to say, but graphic details are not appropriate or important here.

I don't know if the other visitors there on Friday are just still too shaken up to talk about it.  Or just so relieved like us that their kid didn't fall.  Or maybe like me they hate to write online reviews (especially bad ones).  Well I would give Urban Air Trampoline Adventure Park in Trussville, Alabama negative 5 stars if I could, but I can't, so 1 horrible star.  Our little one has had a difficult time since he saw that horrible event on his last outing for Spring Break.  Thank goodness, he made it out ok.  Still, I'm so very sorry we chose  the Trussville Urban Air, but we knew other kids who enjoyed it there in the past.  I'm sorry to say we even teased a teenager who was too scared to ride, but he was wiser than us I guess.  We researched. We read the google reviews first. Obviously, not enough people write reviews.  We thought it was safe (trampoline park safe anyway).  We were wrong!   It's not even safe to sit on the benches and watch your babies.  And the lack of customer followup and consideration just adds to the mess.

Because of the layout of this Urban Air in Trussville, people on the ground are always under one of the air rides!  There should be a safety net or some type of separate area to keep kids above and kids and families below safe!!!!!!  We've visited Homewood Urban Air without a big problem. (Of course they don't have the air rope course and racer).

PLEASE DON'T LET ANYONE YOU LOVE (OR HATE) SIT OR WALK AROUND ANYWHERE IN THIS URBAN AIR LOCATION WHEN SOMEONE IS RIDING ANY AIR ATTRACTION (even with a harness)!!!

I hope this helps someone.  If you saw this, please speak up too and let people know.  It's time.  I can't believe the news didn't cover this.  I wish someone else said it sooner than me.  Every customer who was there Friday deserves answers, although not nearly as much as the injured victims.  We hope and pray they are alive and OK.  Every potential customer deserves answers so that it doesn't happen again.

Urban Air in Trussville, I don't see how you are still open and promoting Birthday packages. But since you are, PLEASE PROTECT YOUR PATRONS( that includes kids riding and also includes moms and babies sitting and watching below)!!   I hope you are at least answering and helping the people you seriously hurt last Friday.

resp.text: Hi Kim,This is Carolyn from the Corporate office. I just read your review this morning (Saturday, April 6th). If you would like to provide a phone number or email address for me to contact you, I can speak to you about your concerns. You may contact me at reviews@urbanairparks.com. My kiddos play at Urban Air Parks frequently and I can assure you safety is at the heart of everything we do. The Trussville Park closed the attraction you mentioned for a thorough inspection. I’m around if you want to talk, we consider our guests an extension of our family.Sincerely,Carolyn McLeanreviews@urbanairparks.comUrban Air’s Corporate Office
